Articles.Content:
UUUUU I push the button just because I know I wont die......(pushes button)......HUUGGAABAAAAGUAaaaaaaaaaaaa, (thud!)

Push the button to have an 90% chance to bring me back to life......please, or a 10% to be mean and gain all my video game knowledge.

Edited December 7, 2013 by Tidus Klein

*Pushes button and gains videogame knowledge* Thanks

Push to fly, with 10% chance that you will die

I dont press the button because on the grand scheme of things 10% chance is really big

Push to be born as awesome creature, 10% your something dumb

Pushes button. LOYO!!!

Push the button to have a 90% chance to die, 10% to become god!

Edited December 7, 2013 by Tidus Klein

I dont push

Press to become king of the world, 99% chance someone will try and kill you.

I dont push

Push for 100% chance to play KSP

You don't understand the part about the downside, do you?

When you press this button, 0.23 will come out. However, there is a 15% chance that Squad will go out of business the next day. What is your choice?

*presses, and squad doesn't go out of business the next day* EXPLOIT ALL THE BUGS!

Press the button for a teleporter, but it doesn't allow scouts, and you become one.

*presses, and squad doesn't go out of business the next day* EXPLOIT ALL THE BUGS!

Press the button for a teleporter, but it doesn't allow scouts, and you become one.

I won't press that button. I hate having useless things at home >.<

If you press the button, all your family and friends will be brutally tortured and killed in front of you, but you'll earn all the knowledge about all the things.

Of course i don't press the button.. i would lose you.! :'( (And you have all the knowledge anyway.. )

If you press the button, you'll earn 20% more money at work, but you have to go up 2 hours earlier.!

no because because i have school and i already get up at 6:00

press the button for a 50 percent chance to earn back all the money that you have spent since you were born to this moment but there is also a 50% chance that you will lose twice that amount right now

Nope.avi too risky

Press the button and you grow wings. But you loose your arms and hands

I dont push.

Push to enter the world of <your choosing>, 50% you will die there.

What if the world we chose is a place where people can't die?

Press it, I'll respawn anyway...

Press the button to unleach the kraken that have 33% to not listen to the frist order you tell him

No, I don't feel like killing people today.

When you press the button, you will have 50% chance to get the most happy life possible. The other 50% is for a eternity in pain.

Ewww... Don't press it, eternity is too long for me and my life is not that bad anyway...

Press the button for cupcake, but there's a little chance (10%) that the cupcake is made of "questionable" ingredients.

I press it and hope that the 10% chance event occurs and poisons me. My life is bad enough anyway

Press for flight, with a 2% chance it'll be on an airplane

Wait... a 2 % chance of being in an airplane? Doesn't that mean I have a 98% chance of falling and dying? Definitely no.

Press the button to successfully build and fly whackjob-size rockets, but you have to replace your graphics card every 2 weeks.

No, I am a KISS zealot.

50% chance of a life in ultimate happiness. 50% chance of never dying(Jack Harkness style)

hells yea! I hope I don't end up like the face of boe. same person i guess (oops)

you live as a kerbal in ksp, as you play it (personally, I try to preserve my kerbals as much as possible, but you might not play that way)

I would. I play KSP NASA pro. And Space is, well, SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE!!!!

Press the button, and you are on a one way trip to your favorite planet.

Nope, SPAAAAACE is my favourite.

Pressed button = 50% chance of derped button, 25% chance of most intelligent button ever, 25% chance of "Stuff" to happen to you.

How derped is that? I'm not gonna press that.

Pressing this button will result in a rocket engine throttling 109% thrust with higher chance of explosion.

Nah. I never hardly use 100% thrust, anyways. I like it in the green.

The button will keep you from having any homework for the rest of your school career, but also age you by the amount of time it would take you to finish said homework.

I don't press.

The button will have a 99 chance to explode you, or 1 to be super rich and intelligent and be Tony Stark.
